Commentary: Rahul Chahar to Vijay, out Stumped!! A ripper of a leg-break and Rahul has struck with his first ball of the comeback over - a top delivery and even better keeping - Vijay looked good during his stint, but he has to walk back to huge roars - that's because the next man in is MS. A quality delivery from Rahul, drifted in, dragged Vijay forward with the length, made him think he could work it to the on-side, then the ball gripped and turned past the outside edge - quicksilver work from de Kock and Vijay was stranded way outside the crease. Commentary: Chahar to Rohit, out Lbw!! Rohit has been given out lbw, he has a chat with QdK and reviews. Did it pitch in-line? That could be the only factor saving Rohit here because there's no bat, HawkEye confirms it. Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - Umpire's call. It's crashing the top of leg-stump. Rohit's a goner. Huge strike for CSK. Glum faces in the MI camp. It's a similar delivery that trapped Chris Lynn. The outswinger again, pitched on a length and straightened viciously leaving Rohit all at sea as he plays down the wrong line. Gets beaten on the outside edge and it clicks him on the back pad. Commentary: Bumrah to Rayudu, out Caught by de Kock!! They sense it. Mumbai are gaining the upper hand. This is such brilliant captaincy from Ro. CSK just lost a wicket and he brings his key bowler back for an over and prises out another. Big roar for MSD as he walks out. Rayudu c de Kock b Bumrah 1(4)

Commentary: Hardik Pandya to Watson, out Dhoni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Phew! What drama! CSK have lost their captain in a big pressure final! This was an overthrow which Dhoni was trying to steal and he will be unhappy with himself for doing something like this in a final. It was a short ball which Watson got the glove on the pull shot, he hit it to Malinga's left and Slinga fired an overthrow at the bowler's end. The ball went only as far as mid-off, but Dhoni tried it take on the fielder but Kishan hit the bulls eye and ignited the stumps. This was a very tough decision to make. One angle showed Dhoni was on the line, but there was another angle which reckoned Dhoni may have just sneaked in. Thoughts of benefit of doubt going to the batsman circled, but Llong took a long time. Saw various different angles and pressed the red button. Dhoni run out (Ishan Kishan) 2(8)

Commentary: Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by de Kock!! 148.5kph of a brute. It's lethal. It's murderous. Commentary: Malinga to SN Thakur, out Lbw!! Slower off-cutter, and things don't dip in the slot any better. 2013. 2015. 2017. 2019, you don't mess with Arithmetic progressions and you don't mess with these mathematical Mumbai Indians. Thakur - poor old Thakur - sent ahead of his usual position - walks across his stumps, freezes bang in front of middle looking to flick it across the line. But again, it's the finals, he chokes, misses and is trapped plumb, bang in front of middle. Oh Malinga, you really couldn't have redeemed yourself any better. SN Thakur lbw b Malinga 2(2)

Commentary: SN Thakur to Krunal Pandya, out Caught&Bowled!! That's a top-catch from Shardul - he called for the ball, sprinted a long way towards square leg, got to the ball and then juggled it, but doesn't panic - holds onto the second attempt and MI have lost their fourth wicket. He's on a roll, the Mumbai speedster. This was a well directed bouncer, short and climbing onto the left-hander, cramped for room, Krunal still went for the pull, gets a big top-edge, high and towards square leg. MS went for the catch, but the bowler called it out and then held on. Krunal Pandya c and b SN Thakur 7(7)

Commentary: Chahar to Rohit, out Caught by Dhoni! The slower one has done it! 119.8km/h, the knuckle ball, that wobbles unpredictably in the air, swerves away, courtesy a falling seam towards the on-side, and Rohit has been done in by the lack of pace - can't decide when to get his weight forward and has a waft at a transfer-of-weight drive into the off-side - his bottom-hand has come off the bat, no control, and he gets a healthy edge. Commentary: Ngidi to Pollard, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and taken. All those bowlers in the CPL, hope you note this length. Back of a length is the toughest to hit. CSK have stolen 10 runs off the total. {{BATSMAN}} c Dhoni b {{BOWLER}} 18(14) [4s-1 6s-1]

Commentary: Shami to Dhawan, out Dhawan Run Out!! A poor dismissal for the Capitals and Dhawan walks back for a duck. He might have actually been reprieved first up, think he gloved the pull and KL spilled it - the ball rolled wide of him and Dhawan thought there was a single on offer - dashed way down the track only to watch his partner motionless at the other end. Too late to return, KL ran across, collected the ball and lobbed in a throw at the striker's end - Gowtham was waiting for it and breaks the stumps, with a disconsolate Dhawan stranded in the middle. Commentary: Cottrell to Axar, out Caught by Rahul!! Has this been taken? KL and Cottrell are ready to celebrate but umpire Nitin Menon pauses them, he isn't sure if the catch is clean. So, they are referring it to the third umpire. Axar is also asked to wait. No doubt about the glove, it's all about the catch. It's dipping on the way to Rahul and seems like he's grabbed it cleanly. OUT is the decision and the batsman can continue his walk back to the hut. Delhi are falling away quickly. A back of a length, veering down leg. Commentary: Ashwin to Pooran, out Bowled!! Got him and Ashwin has two in five balls. What a sweet revenge for the former KXIP skipper. Tosses this around middle and leg and gets it to rip sharply off the surface, Pooran was leaning forward but wasn't ready to counter the extra bounce as it kisses the pad before hitting the top of off. Left-handers against off-spin will always be a challenge and wasn't long ago we witnessed CSK send a left-hander against left-arm spin. Tactics, strategies...ah! What do the data analysts know? Pooran b Ashwin 0(3)

Commentary: Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Dube, out Shivam Dube Run Out!! Just top skills. The field was set for a yorker -- long-off, long-on, deep mid-wicket. But Kumar does the double bluff, going for the quick bouncer. Dube meanwhile had himself committed to his front foot, and by the time he can rock back and look to pull, has the ball going over comfortably. Anyway, then he decides to step out for the single and doesn't even bother getting back in after getting nothing from Philippe as Bairstow runs to the stumps to whip the bails off. Okay, 163 then .. Shivam Dube run out (Bairstow) 7(8)

Bhuvi plays a nothing shot as he tries to slog across the line and only swishes thin air. {{BATSMAN}} b {{BOWLER}} 0(2)

Commentary: Navdeep Saini to Rashid Khan, out Bowled!! Off pole this time. Navdeep Saini likes hitting the stumps and we have seen a lot of that in the domestic cricket. A delivery that was too good for Rashid Khan. 144ks coming in from slightly wide of the crease and Rashid Khan is opened up by the angle, plays outside the line of the delivery and loses his off pole. Surely he's not 100 percent. A normal Rashid would have smashed that full ball over the rope! Rashid Khan b Navdeep Saini 6(5) [4s-1]

Commentary: Rahul Tewatia to Watson, out Bowled!! The pull, the famed Watson pull, has brought about his downfall. Problem is the length isn't short at all. He's just trying to manufacture it out of nothing. Fails badly as this skids through onto his back pad and crashes into leg stump. May have been fooled by the trajectory actually. Tewatia kept it quite flat, pushing it through off the front of his hand. May have caused him to believe it was shorter than it was. Watson's furious with himself. Watson b Rahul Tewatia 33(21) [4s-1 6s-4]

Commentary: Ngidi to Samson, out Caught by Chahar!! That is the end of the Samson show - he's furious with himself as he walks back. Would have been a wide had he let it go - but the adrenaline was pumping and he couldn't hold back - went chasing after that and lifted it towards deep cover - Chahar ran in, took it awkwardly around his chest, reverse cupped - it threatened to pop out, but he manages to clutch it safely. Was the slower short ball and Samson didn't have the pace on the shot. Some relief for the CSKians, they clearly looked rattled. Samson c Chahar b Ngidi 74(32) [4s-1 6s-9]

Commentary: Ngidi to Smith, out Miller Run Out!! 1 run completed. Appeal for a run-out at the bowler's end, Miller dived, has it saved him? A flat throw and a good pick-up. No, the dive's not good enough and Miller falls for a diamond duck on his Royals debut. Unfortunate way to get dismissed - it didn't help that Miller lost his bat as well, could have saved him else. On a length and at the stumps, worked in front of square on the on-side and it was Smith's call for the second. Miller responded well, but lost his bat as he dived - good throw from Gaikwad and Kedar was at hand to break the stumps. Miller run out (Ruturaj Gaikwad/Kedar Jadhav) 0(0)

Commentary: Chawla to Uthappa, out Caught by du Plessis!! A chance and Faf has grabbed it cleanly. Redemption for Piyush, he struggled in the first two overs, but is pulling things back a touch. Commentary: Pollard to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Pollard has his first IPL wicket since 2015. But no, forget that. That's not the best part. Hardik Pandya's a credit stealer .. with Rana slicing yet another off-paced delivery outside off. But that means he's got to manufacture all the pace on this himself, which he can't with these 70-meter-boundaries. Anyway, here's what Pandya does: he's at sweeper, and the ball's quickly flying wide of him to his left. So he runs, intercepts while running, side-on, and makes sure he doesn't overbalance. Sorry, words will never do justice. Nitish Rana c Hardik Pandya b Pollard 24(18) [4s-2 6s-1]

Commentary: Rashid Khan to Karthik, out Lbw!! Celeb appeal and the umpire's finger goes up for LBW. Think DK was happy to go, but he then chatted with his partner and decided to review. Pretty sure the 15-second time gap had elapsed, but here we go. It's a fair delivery and there's no inside edge on that. Was the wrong 'un and DK didn't read it one bit. UltraEdge confirms that there's no bat on that, Hawk-Eye in and it's three REDS. Karthik is OUT and KKR have wasted their review. Lovely delivery from Khan, slipped in the wrong 'un and Karthik didn't spot it - ended up playing outside the line as he lunged forward. Past the inside edge and struck adjacent to middle, was going on and crashing into the middle-stump. SRH keep themselves in the hunt with timely wickets. Karthik lbw b Rashid Khan 0(3)

Commentary: Cummins to Bairstow, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. So, he doesn't last long then. Cummins cleans him up. He's been excellent today, rarely has bowled a bad ball. Misses it altogether on this occasion and the off-pole takes a beating. KKR have struck early here. Cummins is delighted with the breakthrough.. Bairstow b Cummins 5(10)

Commentary: Chakravarthy to Warner, out Caught&Bowled!! First IPL scalp for Varun Chakravarthy in this edition of IPL. And it's the big fish - Warner. A blip in concentration for SRH's captain after the break. A nothing shot really. This gave an impression of stopping upon reaching the batsman. Teased Warner into pushing at it, he went a bit too hard and chips it back to the bowler. Chakravarthy doesn't drop those. It was catching practice indeed. KKR camp are elated. Warner c and b Chakravarthy 36(30) [4s-2 6s-1]

Commentary: Washington Sundar to Rohit, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! First time Sundar has opened the bowling this season and he has got the big wicket of Rohit. Just the start RCB wanted especially after an expensive over from Udana. Rohit had enough of defending and was looking to go for the biggie, the length was fraction short and he was quick to pounce, pulls it high and that would have gone the distance in any other ground but not in Dubai, Negi settles under it at deep mid-wicket and hangs on comfortably. Rohit c (sub)Negi b Washington Sundar 8(8) [6s-1]

Commentary: Zampa to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Negi!! The celebration from Virat Kohli and Co. just tells you this wicket meant a lot to them. Zampa strikes gold for his team as Hardik Pandya departs. They had a solitary wicket in the powerplay before today and that too a lucky dismissal of Warner and now they have two in the space of four balls. Commentary: Rahul Chahar to Kohli, out Caught by Rohit!! No. no. no! You don't want to see that if you are a Kohli fan! That was a painful stay, but credit to Rahul Chahar. He troubled Kohli and deserved this wicket. Was the leggie, probably that diagonal over the wicket angle is troubling him - he was bowling most deliveries to Kohli from that angle. Commentary: Boult to Devdutt Padikkal, out Caught by Pollard!! Pollard takes a really good catch. Boult dropping the slower ball short and wide of off, forcing Padikkal to fetch, Padikkal went for the pull, hit it decently, but big Pollard ran to his left, used all his height to great effect to take a gentle leaping catch. Commentary: Boult to Finch, out Caught by Pollard!! Catching practice for Pollard at long-off - the threatening partnership has been broken. Commentary: Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! One bobble, second pouch. Kumar - bringing all his experience into this - keeps it slow, outside off and forces Hetmyer to reach out and slice it to the longest part of the boundary at long-off. Doesn't matter, he'd miscued it alright as Pandey runs in from the boundary, and holds on with some help from his chest. So SRH finally are into their home territory of small defences, choking out teams at the death. Hetmyer c Manish Pandey b Bhuvneshwar 21(12) [6s-2]

Commentary: Mishra to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rabada!! Weird shot from Pandey!! He had just come in and this isn't the easiest of surfaces to start on. Looks to take Mishra on with the slog sweep but is done in flight and gets a top-edge that's pouched comfortably at deep mid-wicket. It's that longer part of the ground which undid MI yesterday in Dubai, and just like that here in Abu Dhabi, has taken out Pandey today. He was clutching his hamstring last over, so did that play a role in this shot? Either ways, DC aren't complaining. This is a fab phase for them. Manish Pandey c Rabada b Mishra 3(5)

Commentary: Rabada to Bairstow, out Caught by Nortje!! You can't deny Rabada for long at the death. He thrives in these situations and has struck a vital blow here. Cross-seamer from Rabada, very full and Bairstow made room for the loft. Didn't get any timing whatsoever and absolutely sent this straight up into the night skies. We've seen many such ones dropped, but Nortje holds his composure and takes it near the deep mid-off region. Bairstow falls after an workman-like innings. Bairstow c Nortje b Rabada 53(48) [4s-2 6s-1]

Commentary: Mishra to Warner, out Caught by Pant!! Another attempted reverse sweep and Pant reckons there was some glove on that. The Capitals have reviewed the caught behind call. This looks close, think Warner might be in trouble, looked like a feather on the glove. UltraEdge in and there's a minor spike when the ball is past Warner's gloves. That's enough for the third umpire to overturn the original call. Warner is OUT. Think it's a fair decision from the third umpire, Chris Gaffaney. The spike wasn't huge, but there seemed to be a deviation when the ball went past the gloves - Warner was attempting the reverse sweep to one that drifted across him - caught the glove and Pant stood low to hold on. A wicket against the run of play, the dangerous Warner departs. Warner c Pant b Mishra 45(33) [4s-3 6s-2]

Commentary: Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Riyan Parag!! Tewatia gets Rana. Commentary: Pattinson to Pooran, out Caught by de Kock!! A game of angles, nothing else folks. You would think how on earth did a set batsman of Pooran's ability not muscle that juicy full ball over the ropes. but there's a lot on the technical side in this game. Pooran took the invitation without knowing there was trap, he swung too hard and lost a bit of shape which is why he couldn't find the middle. Edge to QdK who takes a simple catch. A lot of times people wonder why Cottrell and not Jordan in a team. It's all about the angles. Left-arm angle to right-handeed batsman isn't all that easy. Pooran c de Kock b Pattinson 44(27) [4s-3 6s-2]

Commentary: Chawla to Warner, out Caught by du Plessis!! Faf is making a habit of pulling off these boundary-flirting catches and he makes it look so easy. Warner is disappointed and he knew he was in trouble from the moment it left the bat. Huge wicket for CSK. Warner danced down the track and perhaps got a little too close to the pitch of the delivery, miscues the loft off the toe-end, it did seem like going for a maximum but there's always a risk involved when you take on a fielder like Faf. He Leaps up full length, grabs the ball on the jump and quickly realizes, he's gonna go over the ropes. What does he do then? Just maintains his composure, lobs the ball in the air before going over the ropes and collects the ball with ease on the second attempt. Warner c du Plessis b Chawla 28(29) [4s-3]

Commentary: Navdeep Saini to Buttler, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! What a way to start your spell! This is a massive strike first-ball by Saini. The dangerous Buttler is out of here. Commentary: Chahal to Samson, out Caught&Bowled!! And he strikes first-ball! What a catch from Chahal! They're checking for a clean catch. Soft signal is OUT. Seemed alright in real time. Okay, the replays are quite confusing. It does seem like a bit of his fingers are under the ball, but also a portion of it seems to be touching the ground. The third umpire isn't sure but he feels there isn't enough evidence to overturn the onfield call. So, Samson has to walk. Huge, huge wicket this. Was doled out full by Chahal and Samson moved leg-side to drive through the covers. Got it off the inside part of the bat and the ball was travelling to the right of the bowler. Commentary: Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Now, now - this is simply sensational from Manish. He's had a shocker by his own high standards today, but he has pulled off an absolute ripper now. Kishan will consider himself desperately unlucky here, length ball and he flat-batted the lofted drive to the right of long-on. Had enough power, but not the elevation. Manish rushed across from long-on, threw himself at the ball - was parallel to the ground when he completed the two-handed catch and then had the sense to make sure that it didn't pop out when his elbow hit the ground. Ishan Kishan c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 31(23) [4s-1 6s-2]

Commentary: Moeen Ali to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Devdutt Padikkal!! Fantastic catch by Padikkal. Huge wicket for RCB as it is the in-form Delhi skipper walking back. He does fancy clearing the rope against the spinners and would have as well if he was playing in Sharjah or Abu Dhabi, but not here. Flighted around off, Iyer goes with the spin and heaves it to deep mid-wicket, Padikkal settles under it and clutches with both hands, then throws the ball up, goes outside the boundary rope and comes back in to complete the catch. Excellent awareness shown by the youngster. Shreyas Iyer c Devdutt Padikkal b Moeen Ali 11(13) [4s-1]

Commentary: Dwayne Bravo to Tripathi, out Caught by Watson!! First wicket for DJ Bravo in IPL 2020. Pushes this fuller and in the outside off zone, Tripathi looks to play a cheeky dab with an open bat face but the ball takes the bottom half and lands in the bucket hands of Watto at short third man. Bravo went up straightaway and so did Watson, the umpires just wanted to be sure as they deemed the soft signal in favor of the bowler. Tripathi c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 81(51) [4s-8 6s-3]

Commentary: Dwayne Bravo to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Dhoni!! Goodness me! That is a spectacular catch from MSD. Sheer commitment and his athleticism was on full display while grabbing the catch. Dhoni seemed to have signalled something to Bravo just before this delivery and I'm guessing it's something to do with lack of pace. Keeps it in the shortish length area does Bravo and induces a thick outside edge on the slog. Dhoni dives full length to his right, juggles it on the first attempt and then takes the rebound with a sharp spring to his right. 150th IPL wicket for Bravo! Shivam Mavi c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 0(1)

Commentary: SN Thakur to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Dhoni!! Big loud nick. Thakur has Gill for the third time in as many IPL innings -- this time with Gill throwing it away after losing patience, losing shape and losing his timing. Commentary: Karn Sharma to Narine, out Caught by du Plessis!! Just Jadeja things! Takes an absolute specky, at deep mid-wicket, diving parallel to the ground to his right and just when he was about to skid onto the boundary triangles, tosses the ball to Faf (running from long-on) to complete the catch. Was loopier and the line teased Narine to go for the big one, attempts a heave, only to be bettered by the fielding brilliance of CSK. The KKR management won't be too disappointed and we could see Narine play more of such roles for the rest of the IPL. Narine c du Plessis b Karn Sharma 17(9) [4s-1 6s-1]

Commentary: Khaleel Ahmed to Agarwal, out Agarwal Run Out!! 1 run completed. A mix-up between the openers and Mayank has to depart. Brilliant stop by Warner at mid-off though. That's that for Agarwal tonight, then. Agarwal run out (Warner/Khaleel Ahmed) 9(6) [4s-1]

Commentary: Rashid Khan to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Cleaned up with a googly! 88.7kph, lands marginally outside off, spins in quite sharply and Mandeep gets into a tangle. He is neither forward nor back to play it. To make matters worse, he is late in bringing in his bat down. The wrong 'un spins past the inside edge to cannon onto the sticks. Mandeep b Rashid Khan 6(6)

Commentary: Khaleel Ahmed to Mujeeb, out Caught by Bairstow!! An appeal for caught-behind, SRH decide against the review. Meanwhile, the umpires have sent it upstairs to check if it was a bump ball. The soft signal is Not Out. A yorker length ball from round the wicket, Mujeeb stays leg-side of the ball to jam it out. Don't think it is a bump ball. OUT signalled on the giant screen. And, the drama doesn't end there. Mujeeb starts to walk ... and then decides to challenge the call. The umpires had a chat and decided to call the third umpire, again! A review for caught-behind. There's a spike on Ultra Edge and it's clearly an outside edge as the bat hits the ground later. After all the drama, Mujeeb is out and he's wasted a review too. Mujeeb c Bairstow b Khaleel Ahmed 1(3)

Commentary: Ravi Bishnoi to Warner, out Caught by Maxwell!! A wicket for Kings XI after almost 35 overs. Remember the Pollard-Pandya carnage, then Watson-Faf chase and now this. It is the young leggie who has broken this partnership. Warner had to go as Bairstow was playing for those three runs to get to his hundred. Commentary: Ravi Bishnoi to Bairstow, out Lbw!! Excellent review from Rahul. There was a run out and Samad was short, but he wanted the bigger fish. Challenged the LBW call and got it overturned. This was the slider which skids on, Bairstow is caught in the crease, beaten for pace as he misses the nudge to the on-side, struck on the back pad in front of leg-stump and ball-tracking had it smashing into the sticks. So, Bairstow falls three short of his hundred and young Bishnoi has sent back both openers in a space of four balls. Bairstow lbw b Ravi Bishnoi 97(55) [4s-7 6s-6]

Commentary: Tye to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! What a game young Yashaswi Jaiswal is having. He may not have starred with the bat yet, but he's done enough in this game already to make his presence felt in the side. Shane Warne is happy in the stands. Iyer pushed this towards extra cover and wanted a quick single, Pant was hesitant and sent him back after a momentary sprint. The DC skipper though was too far down the pitch and Jaiswal hit the stumps direct with a rifle-like throw. Brilliant work from the teenager. Shreyas Iyer run out (Jaiswal) 22(18) [4s-4]

Commentary: Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, out Pant Run Out!! If there is one IPL game Pant never wants to revisit, this could be the one. He looked completely off today and his running explains everything. Stoinis knocked this towards mid-wicket and took a default sprint trying to sneak a single, Pant though was in a different planet. Doesn't even bat an eye at the field and just jogs blindly towards the batting end. The fielder at mid-wicket was sharp and he quickly threw it to the bowler who completed the formalities. Pant tried to get back, but he wasn't even in the frame. Pant run out ((sub)Vohra/Rahul Tewatia) 5(9)

Commentary: Stoinis to Jaiswal, out Bowled!! Yea, yea, declare it, Stoinis' IPL. Commentary: Axar to Tye, out Caught by Rabada!! Flat, short, angling in, cramping out room. Yep, you've read this before. This is bang in Axar Patel's territory, his mastery. Tye goes on the back foot, clears his front leg, swats across the line, and miscues it away into square leg somewhere. Rabada probably loses the ball, or maybe he's just late to pick it up, but never mind, he's moved quickly to his right, dived, stuck his hands out, and gotten it to stick. Tye c Rabada b Axar 6(6) [6s-1]

Commentary: Harshal Patel to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Hetmyer!! The perfect slap. But what can you do when the catch is the mother of perfects? Who else but Hetmyer. Where else but deep sweeper. And what else but a forward diving take to intercept Gopal's flashy cut. It's clearly into his fingers, but when you've taken the decision to the third umpire, why not play around with a zillion replays, waste time, and then give it out. Yes. Shreyas Gopal c Hetmyer b Harshal Patel 2(3)
